summary: CDC provided technical support to MoH to increase capacity building in three health-system areas. detection of health threats through laboratory and other systems, coordination of information and response including through EOCs, and prevention of avoidable health threats. a holistic approach was taken to enhance specimen referral, testing, and informatics networks. 80% of international health regulations signatories have not met 2012 objectives. CDC has committed to assist countries with national surveillance and response activities to prevent, detect, and respond to public health threats. this report describes rapid global health security enhancements in Uganda targeting three areas. security against epidemic disease is dependent on the capacity to prevent, detect, and respond to outbreaks as early as possible. the Uganda GHS project was able to record considerable systems improvements that might serve as a model for GHS acceleration in other countries.
